metadata.title: USN-5958-1 -- FFmpeg vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that FFmpeg could be made to dereference a null pointer. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service via application crash. These issues only affected Ubuntu 16.04 ESM, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. (CVE-2022-3109, CVE-2022-3341)  It was discovered that FFmpeg could be made to access an out-of-bounds frame by the Apple RPZA encoder. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service via application crash or access sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS and Ubuntu 22.10. (CVE-2022-3964)  It was discovered that FFmpeg could be made to access an out-of-bounds frame by the QuickTime encoder. An attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service via application crash or access sensitive information. This issue only affected Ubuntu 22.10. (CVE-2022-3965)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5958-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libavcodec59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavformat-extra - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavcodec-extra - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavcodec-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavutil-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavfilter-extra - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libswscale-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libswresample-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libswresample4 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavdevice-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libswscale6 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavformat59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavdevice59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavfilter-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavformat-extra59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libpostproc-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libpostproc56 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavfilter8 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavcodec-extra59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavfilter-extra8 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavformat-dev - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 libavutil57 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 ffmpeg - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 ffmpeg-doc - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
